variant.name: Address
variant.summary: The form is an address form.

variant.name: CreditCard
variant.summary: The form is a credit card form.

variant.name: ConditionalAblation
variant.summary: The sample is recorded only when there was data available to be filled and it was assigned to the ablation case.

variant.name: ConditionalControl
variant.summary: The sample is recorded only when there was data available to be filled and it was assigned to the control case.

variant.name: UnconditionalAblation
variant.summary: The sample is recorded regardless whether data was available to be filled and assigned to the ablation case.

variant.name: UnconditionalControl
variant.summary: The sample is recorded regardless whether data was available to be filled and assigned to the control case.

variant.name: Cvc
variant.summary: CVC authentication only

variant.name: CvcFallbackFromFido
variant.summary: CVC fallback from FIDO authentication

variant.name: CvcThenFido
variant.summary: CVC followed by FIDO authentication

variant.name: Fido
variant.summary: FIDO authentication only

variant.name: CardLinkedOffer
variant.summary: The bubble/infobar for an offer that is linked to a credit card.

variant.name: FirstShow
variant.summary: The bubble is shown for the first time.

variant.name: Reshows
variant.summary: The bubble is re-shown.

variant.name: ServerCard
variant.summary: The card is a server card.

variant.name: VirtualCard
variant.summary: The card is a virtual card.

variant.name: Failure
variant.summary: Request failed during the authentication process. This is not related to virtual cards.

variant.name: NetworkError
variant.summary: Unable to connect to Payments servers. Prompt user to check internet connection.

variant.name: Success
variant.summary: Request succeeded.

variant.name: VcnRetrievalFailure
variant.summary: Request failed in retrieving the virtual card information.

variant.name: VirtualCard
variant.summary: Snackbar shown after virtual card is autofilled.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ablation.FillDurationSinceInteraction.{FormType}.{Group}
histogram.summary: Records for time from the first change to an input element (typed or autofilled) on any form of a frame to a form submission. Note that the change could even happen to a different form on the page than the one submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ablation.FormSubmissionAfterInteraction.{FormType}.{Group}
histogram.summary: Records whether after changing the value of an input element (typed or autofilled) in a frame, any form on that page is submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.Address.IsEnabled.PageLoad
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Profile (Address) Autofill is enabled on page load for a page containing forms.

histogram.name: Autofill.Address.IsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Profile (Address) Autofill is enabled when Chrome launches.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressesDeletedForDisuse
histogram.summary: The number of unverified autofill addresses deleted because they have not been used for a long time, and are not used as billing addresses of valid credit cards. Note the deletion only happens once per major version upgrade.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressesSuppressedForDisuse
histogram.summary: The number of address suggestions not shown in the Autofill popup because they have not been used recently enough. Note that suppression only applies when the user has not typed any text into the field. If any text is in the field, all matching addresses are displayed, regardless of how recently they have been used.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressProfileImportCountrySpecificFieldRequirements
histogram.summary: Each country can require different fields (ZIP code, state, city) to exist for an address to be valid. This histogram logs which mandatory fields were missing in a submitted address form.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressProfileImportRequirements
histogram.summary: Logs whether the individual requirements for importing an address profile are met at form submission time.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressProfileImportStatus
histogram.summary: Logs the overall status of a profile import attempt on form submission time.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionsCount
histogram.summary: The number of address suggestions shown in the Autofill popup.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressTokenVerificationStatusAtProfileUsage.{AddressType}
histogram.summary: For each {AddressType} in a given AutofillProfile, the verification status of the corresponding non-empty type is recorded when a profile is used to fill a form.

variant.name: Any
variant.summary: any of the following

variant.name: ApartmentNumber
variant.summary: the apartment number of the address

variant.name: FloorNumber
variant.summary: the floor number of the address

variant.name: HouseNumber
variant.summary: the house number of the address

variant.name: Premise
variant.summary: the premise of the address

variant.name: StreetAddress
variant.summary: the full street address

variant.name: StreetName
variant.summary: the street name of the address

variant.name: SubPremise
variant.summary: the subpremise of the address

histogram.name: Autofill.Autocomplete.NotOff.EditedAutofilledFieldAtSubmission
histogram.summary: Records at submission time for each autofilled field with autocomplete != off whether the user edited the autofilled field value or not.

histogram.name: Autofill.Autocomplete.NotOff.FillingAcceptance
histogram.summary: Records for each submitted form whether the user accepted the suggestion to fill values and the triggering field has autocomplete != off. This is counted as 'yes' if the user accepted such a suggestion at any time, regardless whether other suggestions were ignored or whether the accepted suggestion was reverted afterwards.

histogram.name: Autofill.Autocomplete.Off.EditedAutofilledFieldAtSubmission
histogram.summary: Records at submission time for each autofilled field with autocomplete = off whether the user edited the autofilled field value or not.

histogram.name: Autofill.Autocomplete.Off.FillingAcceptance
histogram.summary: Records for each submitted form whether the user accepted the suggestion to fill values and the triggering field has autocomplete = off. This is counted as 'yes' if the user accepted such a suggestion at any time, regardless whether other suggestions were ignored or whether the accepted suggestion was reverted afterwards.

histogram.name: Autofill.AutocompleteEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether autocomplete is enabled.

histogram.name: Autofill.AutocompleteQuery
histogram.summary: Whether an autocomplete query is created for a field.

histogram.name: Autofill.AutocompleteSuggestions
histogram.summary: Whether there is any suggestions for an autocomplete query.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.CardUnmaskDuration.Fido
histogram.summary: Tracks the time it takes to fetch the full PAN of a credit card once user successfully authenticates using WebAuthn.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.CardUnmaskDuration.Fido.{CardType}.{Result}
histogram.summary: Tracks the time it takes to fetch the full PAN of a credit card once user successfully authenticates using WebAuthn.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.CardUnmaskPreflightCalled
histogram.summary:
Tracks the number of times Chrome made a GetDetailsForGetRealPan call. A preflight call is only made when card suggestions are shown, and can only happen when the user has server cards and is eligible for WebAuthn.
As a percentage of the number of times card suggestions are shown, which is tracked under Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard, this metric provides an estimate for the potential reach for the Autofill Better Auth project. Moreover, this acts as a baseline value for other metrics in this project.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.CardUnmaskPreflightDuration
histogram.summary: Tracking the latency of a GetDetailsForGetRealPan call to Payments servers. This duration should be comparable to that of Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.Duration and should ideally stay under 500 ms in order for the user to autofill their credit card without experiencing much friction.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.CardUnmaskTypeDecision
histogram.summary: If the user is definitely opted-in to the new auth flow, Payments sends a list of instrument IDs in the GDFGRP call, and Chrome makes the final call on whether CVC or WebAuthn should be shown. Tracks which authentication method was prompted.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.FlowEvents
histogram.summary: Tracks when a user completes each step in a card unmasking flow per authentication type. This will provide a relative conversion rate for each authentication type.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.FlowEvents.{BetterAuthFlowType}.{CardType}
histogram.summary: Tracks when a user completes each step in a card unmasking flow per authentication flow type, with an additional breakdown for if it was a server card or virtual card.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.OptInCalled
histogram.summary: Tracks when users opt-in either from the settings page or from a checkout flow, making an UpdateAutofillUserPreference call. For each call to payments, logs if the call was made in order to verify an existing credential, to create a new credential, or to fetch a challenge.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.OptInPromoShown
histogram.summary:
Logs the number of times the opt-in promo to use FIDO authentication for card unmasking has been shown. Only applicable on Desktop.
This is useful when compared to Autofill.BetterAuth.OptInPromoUserDecision, to see what percentage of users are interacting with the dialog. Also, when an opted-out user receives the preflight call before selecting a card (which is recorded by the first bucket in Autofill.BetterAuth.UserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection.OptedOut), then the promo should eventually show if the user selects a masked card and successfully authenticates through CVC.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.OptInPromoUserDecision
histogram.summary: Tracks the user response to the opt-in promo for using FIDO authentication for card unmasking. The user can either accept the promo and proceed to perform user-verification, can decline the promo immediately, or first accept the promo but then decline while the challenge is being fetched. Only applicable on Desktop.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.OptOutCalled.FromSettingsPage
histogram.summary:
Tracks the number of times UpdateAutofillUserPreference has been called with the intention of opting out from FIDO authentication using the toggle switch on the payments section on the settings page.
This will be useful when compared to values in Autofill.BetterAuth.OptInCalled to give an idea of what percentage of users decide to opt-out.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.UserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection
histogram.summary: The GetDetailsForGetRealPan call is made when card suggestions are shown. This metric tracks whether the response is received before or after a card is chosen by the user. For an opted-in user, a late response would imply perceived latency. For an opted-out user, a late response would imply that opt-in may not have been offered.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.UserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection.OptedIn.Duration
histogram.summary: The GetDetailsForGetRealPan call is made when card suggestions are shown. This metric logs the duration of the perceived latency when the response for this call is received after a card is chosen by an opted-in user. After waiting a set number of seconds without receiving a response, Chrome will fall back to CVC authentication.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.UserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection.OptedIn.TimedOutCvcFallback
histogram.summary: The GetDetailsForGetRealPan call is made when card suggestions are shown. If an opted-in user selects a card before the response is returned, latency is perceived. Given that the user perceives latency, this metric logs whether the request timed out and fell back to CVC or if the request was completed and continued to WebAuthn.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.UserVerifiabilityCheckDuration
histogram.summary: Tracks how long it takes to check that the user is verifiable through WebAuthn's IsUserVerifiablePlatformAuthenticatorAvailable() call. This check is done before deciding to make a GetDetailsForGetRealPan call to Payments.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.WebauthnResult
histogram.summary: This metric tracks the result of the WebAuthn prompt when the user attempts to either opt-in for FIDO authentication or unmask a card using FIDO authentication.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardholderNameFixFlowPrompt.Events
histogram.summary: Events tracking the usage of the cardholder name fix flow prompt. This prompt is triggered whenever cardholder name must be explicitly requested from the user in order to upload the card to Google Payments.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUnmask.CvcLength
histogram.summary: Records the length of CVCs sent to Payments when making card unmask calls, to help determine if blank or invalid length CVCs are being sent.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUploadDecisionMetric
histogram.summary: Whether upload was offered upon detecting a form submission with credit card data, a detailed reason if upload was offered even with some missing fields and detailed reasons if it wasn't.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUploadEnabled
histogram.summary: Detailed reasons why (or why not) card upload was enabled. When a user submits a form, this check is triggered to decide whether to ask the user if she wants to upload the card.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.IsEnabled.PageLoad
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Credit Card Autofill is enabled on page load for a page containing forms.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.IsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Credit Card Autofill is enabled when Chrome launches.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardFillingInfoBar
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept, deny, or ignore the Autofill credit card assisted filling infobar prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept, deny, or ignore the Autofill credit card info bar prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardsDeletedForDisuse
histogram.summary: The number of credit card deleted during a major version upgrade because they have not been used recently enough and are expired.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardsSuppressedForDisuse
histogram.summary: The number of credit card suggestions not shown in the Autofill popup because they have not been used recently enough and are expired. Note that suppression only applies when the user has not typed any text into the field. If any text is in the field, all matching cards are displayed, regardless of how recently they have been used and their expiration status.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardUploadFeedback
histogram.summary: Records when credit card upload provides feedback on its status to the user.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysSinceLastUse.CreditCard
histogram.summary: Logs the number of days that have passed since the credit card was last used.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysSinceLastUse.Profile
histogram.summary: Logged at the time of autofill address use, this histogram captures the number of days that have passed since the address was last used. I.e., the distribution of time between uses of an "active" autofill address.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysSinceLastUse.StoredCreditCard
histogram.summary: Logs the number of days that have passed since each credit card belonging to a given Chrome Profile was last used. This is logged for each Autofill credit card once per Chrome User Profile load.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysSinceLastUse.StoredProfile
histogram.summary: This histogram captures the number of days that have passed since each stored address profile belonging to a given Chrome Profile was last used. This is logged for each Autofill address profile once per Chrome User Profile load.

histogram.name: Autofill.DeveloperEngagement
histogram.summary: Measures the adoption of the HTML autocomplete type hint specification (see http://is.gd/whatwg_autocomplete for more details). For each fillable form detected, logs whether that form includes author-specified type hints.

histogram.name: Autofill.EditedAutofilledFieldAtSubmission.Aggregate
histogram.summary: Total number of fields at submission time that were autofilled and have or have not been editing by the user afterwards.

histogram.name: Autofill.EditedAutofilledFieldAtSubmission.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: Total number of fields at submission time of a specific type that were autofilled and have or have not been editing by the user afterwards.

histogram.name: Autofill.ErrorDialogShown
histogram.summary: Log when an autofill error dialog is shown to the user along with its type.

histogram.name: Autofill.ExpirationDateFixFlowPrompt.Events
histogram.summary: Events tracking the usage of the expiration date fix flow prompt. This prompt is triggered whenever expiration date must be explicitly requested from the user in order to upload the card to Google Payments.

histogram.name: Autofill.ExpirationDateFixFlowPromptShown
histogram.summary: The number of times the expiration date fix flow prompt is shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.FieldCount
histogram.summary: Number of fields in a form that Autofill encounters.

histogram.name: Autofill.FieldPrediction
histogram.summary: Predicted and actual form field type. This is a computed sparse histogram where the value is ((predicted << 16)| actual). Predicted and actual are taken from the autofill::ServerFieldType enumeration.

histogram.name: Autofill.FieldPredictionQuality.Aggregate
histogram.summary: Aggregate Autofill field-type prediction outcomes. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Confusion_matrix for an explanation of the values.

histogram.name: Autofill.FieldPredictionQuality.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: Autofill field-type prediction outcomes, broken down by field type. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Confusion_matrix for an explanation of the values.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromInteraction.WithAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for an autofilled form. An interaction requires changing a form control's value manually or via autofill. The interaction can happen on a different form than the one which is submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromInteraction.WithoutAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for a non-autofilled form. An interaction requires changing a form control's value manually or via autofill. The interaction can happen on a different form than the one which is submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromLoad.WithAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for an autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromLoad.WithoutAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for a non-autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormCacheSize
histogram.summary: Records the peak number of the form cache size. The peak size is reached when navigating to a new page or when the page is refreshed. The metric is counted once for every loaded frame.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.Address
histogram.summary: Autofill form events for address forms. These are recorded when the user interacts with a form requesting an address.
histogram.details: Important caveat about submission metrics: - Submission using autofill data is determined by simply evaluating if there was a fill operation in this page. So, if the user filled with local data, completed erased or modified the data after and then submitted, we would only emit one "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)"; - The submission segmentation works by checking what kind of data was last filled for this type of form in the page load. So, if a user initially filled with local data and after that filled with server, we will only emit "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)".

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard
histogram.summary: Autofill form events for credit card forms. These are recorded when the user interacts with a form requesting a credit card.
histogram.details: Important caveat about submission metrics: - Submission using autofill data is determined by simply evaluating if there was a fill operation in this page. So, if the user filled with local data, completed erased or modified the data after and then submitted, we would only emit one "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)"; - The submission segmentation works by checking what kind of data was last filled for this type of form in the page load. So, if a user initially filled with local data and after that filled with server, we will only emit "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)".

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard.OnNonsecurePage
histogram.summary: Autofill form events for credit card forms on nonsecure pages. These are recorded when the user interacts with a form requesting a credit card.
histogram.details: Important caveat about submission metrics: - Submission using autofill data is determined by simply evaluating if there was a fill operation in this page. So, if the user filled with local data, completed erased or modified the data after and then submitted, we would only emit one "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)"; - The submission segmentation works by checking what kind of data was last filled for this type of form in the page load. So, if a user initially filled with local data and after that filled with server, we will only emit "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)".

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard.WithOffer
histogram.summary: Autofill form events for credit card forms. These are recorded when the user interacts with a form requesting a credit card, a dropdown of suggestions is shown and at least one of the suggestions has a linked credit card offer.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard.WithServerNickname
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2020 as it is launched and no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: Autofill form events for credit card forms. These are recorded when the user interacts with a form requesting a credit card, a dropdown of suggestions is shown and at least one of the suggestions has a server nickname available.
histogram.details: These metrics are used to measure the impact of the server card nickname experiment. They are used to calculate the suggestion selection rate with server nickname available. We will run the experiment on the same group of user who has server cards with nicknames to compare the selection rate. For enabled user, we will show nickname and log. For the other, we won't show nickname in suggestion but we still log to this histogram.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard.WithServerNickname.SelectionDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2020 as it is launched and no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between when the first Autofill suggestion is shown and user first chooses a card, for a credit card form, where the user has at least one card with a server nickname available. Log only once per form. We will run the experiment on the same group of user who have server cards with nicknames to compare the selection duration. For enabled user, we will show nickname and log. For the other, we won't show nickname in suggestion but we still log to this histogram.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormFillSuccessIOS
histogram.summary: Records whether the the form was successfully filled by Autofill on iOS.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormSubmission.PerProfileType
histogram.summary: This histogram records the browser profile type when an autofill form is submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormSubmittedState
histogram.summary: The autofill state related to a submitted form.

histogram.name: Autofill.Funnel.FillAfterSuggestion
histogram.summary:
Counts whether users accepted any autofill suggestion that was shown to them for a given form.
This metric is only recorded if a suggestion for the given form type (see histogram name) was shown at least once. This is recorded once per form. If the user accepts one suggestion, this is reported as "User chose to fill" once. It does not matter if the user clears the filled values nor if the user accepts a different suggestion later.

histogram.name: Autofill.Funnel.InteractionAfterParsedAsType
histogram.summary:
Counts whether users interacted with a form of a certain type.
Focusing a field is sufficient to consider a form as being interacted with. The user does not need to type anything. Note that some forms may get focused on page load.
This metric is recorded once per form observed by Autofill, but only for forms that Autofill classifies to be of the type indicated by the histogram name. If a form changes dynamically, Autofill interprets the forms before and after the change as two different forms and records two values. If a form did not have features that classify it as a form of a certain type (e.g. an address form or payment form), then nothing is recorded.

histogram.name: Autofill.Funnel.ParsedAsType
histogram.summary:
Counts whether a form was parsed/interpreted to be of the type indicated in the histogram name.
This metric is recorded once for each form observed by Autofill. If a form changes dynamically, then Autofill treats the different versions of the form as different forms.

histogram.name: Autofill.Funnel.SubmissionAfterFill
histogram.summary:
Counts whether users submitted a form that was filled via autofill.
This metric is recorded once for each form observed by Autofill but only for forms that the user filled via Autofill.

histogram.name: Autofill.Funnel.SuggestionAfterInteraction
histogram.summary:
Counts whether users were shown suggestions to fill the form, given that they have already interacted with the form.
This metric is recorded only for forms that users interacted with. It is recorded only once per form, meaning that it does not matter how often the user sees suggestions. If a form changes dynamically, then Autofill treats the different versions of the form as different forms.

histogram.name: Autofill.HadUserOptedIn_To_WalletSyncTransportServerCards
histogram.summary: Whether the user had opted-in to seeing their server cards in Wallet Sync Transport mode. Recorded when showing the autofill dropdown for credit cards.

histogram.name: Autofill.HiddenOrPresentationalSelectFieldsFilled
histogram.summary: Logs when a hidden or presentational field is autofilled. The hidden or presentational fields are only autofilled for 'select' fields to support synthetic fields.

histogram.name: Autofill.ImageFetcher.Result
histogram.summary: Record the image fetch result of one image. If true, then the image was fetched successfully.

histogram.name: Autofill.InvalidProfileData.UsedForMetrics
histogram.summary: Tracks whether or not autofill suppressed sending votes or calculating quality metrics because the profile data was marked as invalid. Logged during field-type validation if/when a field marked as invalid is found to match the submitted data.

histogram.name: Autofill.InvalidProfileData.UsedForSuggestion
histogram.summary: Tracks whether or not autofill suppressed offering an autofill suggestion because the profile data was marked as invalid. Logged during autofill suggestion generation when a suggestion is about to generated based on a field marked as invalid.

histogram.name: Autofill.IsEnabled.PageLoad
histogram.summary: This includes Autofill.Address.IsEnabled.PageLoad and Autofill.CreditCard.IsEnabled.PageLoad, and tracks whether either profile Autofill or payment Autofill is enabled on page load for a page containing forms. It helps deduce the overlap by showing what percentage of users have one type of Autofill enabled but not the other.

histogram.name: Autofill.IsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: This includes Autofill.Address.IsEnabled.Startup and Autofill.CreditCard.IsEnabled.Startup, and tracks whether either profile Autofill or payment Autofill is enabled when Chrome launches. It helps deduce the overlap by showing what percentage of users have one type of Autofill enabled but not the other.

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingAcceptance
histogram.summary: Counts for submitted forms whether users accepted the suggestion to fill values. This is counted as 'yes' if the user accepted such a suggestion at any time, regardless whether other suggestions were ignored or whether the accepted suggestion was reverted afterwards.

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingAssistance
histogram.summary:
Counts for submitted forms whether the user filled any fields via Autofill.
If the user reverts the filling, the form is still counted as filled.
This metric is different from Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingAcceptance in the sense that the latter is only recorded if the user has actually seen a prompt to fill data.

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingCorrectness
histogram.summary: Counts for submitted and autofilled forms whether users edited at least one filled value before submitting the form.

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingReadiness
histogram.summary:
Counts for submitted forms whether Chromium had any address or payments data to fill.
It does not matter whether the user actually requested to fill the data. It does not matter either whether the data available for filling corresponded to the submitted data.

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyMetrics.FormSubmission.Autofilled
histogram.summary:
Counts for filled (by Autofill) forms whether users submitted those forms.
This is only recorded for forms that the user filled via Autofill. It does not matter if the user reverted the filling afterwards.
This is recorded once Autofill stops tracking the form (e.g. due to a navigation or due to removal from the DOM).

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyMetrics.FormSubmission.NotAutofilled
histogram.summary:
Counts for not filled (by Autofill) forms whether users submitted those forms.
This is only recorded for forms into which the user typed anything but did not fill anything. It does not matter if the user reverted what they typed.
This is recorded once Autofill stops tracking the form (e.g. due to a navigation or due to removal from the DOM).

histogram.name: Autofill.LocalCardMigrationBubbleOffer
histogram.summary: Record events related to bubble showing. Logged when bubble is requested or is actually shown to users.

histogram.name: Autofill.LocalCardMigrationBubbleResult
histogram.summary: Records whether and how the local card migration bubble was accepted or closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.LocalCardMigrationBubbleUserInteraction
histogram.summary: Record how bubble is closed by different user interactions.

histogram.name: Autofill.LocalCardMigrationDecision
histogram.summary: Record the decisions made when determining if local card migration should be offered.

histogram.name: Autofill.LocalCardMigrationDialogActiveDuration
histogram.summary: Record duration of the local card migration dialog being visible to users.

histogram.name: Autofill.LocalCardMigrationDialogOffer
histogram.summary: Record events related to showing the local card migration dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.LocalCardMigrationDialogUserInteraction
histogram.summary: Record user interactions related to local card migration dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.LocalCardMigrationDialogUserSelectionPercentage
histogram.summary: Record the percentage of cards selected by the user in the migration dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.LocalCardMigrationOrigin
histogram.summary: Records when local card migration prompts are shown and/or accepted.

histogram.name: Autofill.ManageCardsPrompt
histogram.summary: The frequency of user interactions with the Manage Cards prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.MigrateUserOptedInToWalletSync
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when the bit that indicates the user is opted in to wallet sync transport is migrated (part of the migration from using email to using Gaia ID as the account identifier).

histogram.name: Autofill.NameTokenVerificationStatusAtProfileUsage.{NameType}
histogram.summary: For each {NameType} in a given AutofillProfile, the verification status of the corresponding non-empty type is recorded when a profile is used to fill a form.

variant.name: Any
variant.summary: any of the following

variant.name: FirstLast
variant.summary: the first last name of the profile

variant.name: Full
variant.summary: the full name of the profile

variant.name: Last
variant.summary: the last name of the profile

variant.name: Middle
variant.summary: the middle name of the profile

variant.name: SecondLast
variant.summary: the second last name of the profile

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfAutofilledFieldsAtSubmission.{AcceptanceStatus}
histogram.summary: The {AcceptanceStatus} autofilled fields in a form after receiving a form submission event.

variant.name: Accepted
variant.summary: number of accepted

variant.name: Corrected
variant.summary: number of corrected

variant.name: Total
variant.summary: total number of

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfEditedAutofilledFieldsAtSubmission
histogram.summary: The number of autofilled fields that were subsequently edited prior to the form being submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfProfilesConsideredForDedupe
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill profiles that have been considered for deduplication.

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfProfilesRemovedDuringDedupe
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill profiles that have been removed during deduplication.

histogram.name: Autofill.NumElementsMatchesNumFields
histogram.summary: Records whether the number of fillable form elements matches the number of fields in the form's description. Instances where this is recorded as False, denote cases where autofill failed to preview/fill an autofill suggestion. This can happen when a fields is filtered out of a formless form.

histogram.name: Autofill.Offer.SelectedCardHasOffer
histogram.summary: When at least one of the cards in the Autofill suggestions list has a linked offer and the user selects a suggestion, this metric records whether or not the selected suggestion had a linked offer. Nothing is recorded if none of the cards suggested have linked offers.

histogram.name: Autofill.Offer.StoredOfferCount
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of autofill offers data a user has stored, measured at Chrome profile launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.Offer.StoredOfferRelatedCardCount
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of the credit cards an autofill card linked offer data is related to, measured at Chrome profile launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.Offer.StoredOfferRelatedMerchantCount
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of the merchants an autofill offer data is related to, measured at Chrome profile launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.Offer.SubmittedCardHasOffer
histogram.summary: When at least one of the cards in the Autofill suggestions list has a linked offer and the user submits the form, this metric records whether or not the form was submitted using the card with a linked offer. Nothing is recorded if none of the cards suggested have linked offers.

histogram.name: Autofill.Offer.SuggestedCardsHaveOffer
histogram.summary: When the user is shown the Autofill suggestions list, this metric records whether or not a credit card that is linked to an offer is shown as part of the suggestions.

histogram.name: Autofill.Offer.SyncedOfferDataBeingValid
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the offer data is valid or not, measured whenever offer data is synced down via Sync.

histogram.name: Autofill.OfferNotificationBubbleOffer.{BubbleType}
histogram.summary: Records whether the offer notification bubble is the first such offer that the user has been shown or is reshown due to user actions. The metric is recorded when the bubble is shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.OfferNotificationBubbleResult.{BubbleType}.{ShowType}
histogram.summary: Records the reason for closing the offer notification bubble. Recorded when the bubble is closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.OfferNotificationInfoBarOffer.{OfferType}
histogram.summary: Emits true when the offer notification infobar is displayed and does not emit any value otherwise.

histogram.name: Autofill.OfferNotificationInfoBarResult.{OfferType}
histogram.summary: Records the reason for closing the offer notification infobar for {OfferType}. Recorded when the infobar is closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.PageTranslationStatus
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the visible page language was translated or not upon form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.PerfectFilling.{FormType}
histogram.summary: For a form of type {FormType}, log at submission time if the filling experience was perfect. In a perfect filling experience, all non-empty fields have been autofilled without subsequent corrections. Note that the {FormType} is not mutually exclusive. If a single form contains both address and credit card information, the metric is recorded for each {FormType}. In such a combined form, both the address and the credit card information needs to be filled perfectly, in order to record perfect filling.

variant.name: Addresses
variant.summary: Form contains address information.

variant.name: CreditCards
variant.summary: Forms contains credit card information.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileActionOnFormSubmitted
histogram.summary: The profile action that took place when a form was submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.NewProfileDecision
histogram.summary: Logs the user's decision for storing a new address profile observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.NewProfileEditedType
histogram.summary: Logs that a specific type was edited in a new profile save prompt that was shown to the user when a new address profile is observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.NewProfileNumberOfEditedFields
histogram.summary: Logs the number of fields that have been edited by the user in the process of succesfully importing a new profile after an observed form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.ProfileImportType
histogram.summary: The type of an import of an address that is observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted once the import decision is final. This does not necessarily mean that the user was prompted.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileAffectedType
histogram.summary: Logs that a specific type was changed in a profile update process that was shown to the user when a profile similar to an already exisintg profile was observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted only when the user accepts the update without further edits.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileDecision
histogram.summary: Logs the user's decision for editing an already existing address after a similar profile was observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileEditedType
histogram.summary: Logs that a specific type was edited in a profile update prompt that was shown to the user when a profile similar to an already exisintg profile was observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileNumberOfAffectedFields
histogram.summary: Logs the number of fields that have been changed in the process of succesfully updating an existing profile after an observed form submission. This metric is only collected if the profile update is accepted by the user without further edits.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileNumberOfEditedFields
histogram.summary: Logs the number of fields that have been edited by the user in the process of succesfully updating an existing profile after an observed form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileSuggestionsMadeWithFormatter
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when the autofill-use-improved-label-disambiguation experiment is enabled and profile suggestions are available. This metric measures how often suggestions were created with and without a formatter.

histogram.name: Autofill.QueriedCreditCardFormIsSecure
histogram.summary: For credit card forms that are queried for Autofill, a ratio of how many are within secure contexts (which includes mixed passive content).

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.BackoffDelay
histogram.summary: The delay of a network request for a query due to exponential backoff.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.FailingPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that were sent in a query that subsequently failed. This is to help determine the appropriate threshold at which autofill queries should switch from GET to POST, and if there are certain sizes of queries which are prone to failure.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.HttpResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: The http response code or net error code returned on a query.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.Method
histogram.summary: The HTTP method used to query the autofill server.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.RequestDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of a network request for a query.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.WasInCache
histogram.summary: Was the autofill query response retrieved from the HTTP cache.

histogram.name: Autofill.RationalizationQuality.PhoneNumber
histogram.summary: The quality of fields rationalization, putting rationalization result into good/ok/bad categories.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCardCardholderNamePrefilled
histogram.summary: If the cardholder name fix flow is shown when credit card upload is offered, records if the cardholder name textfield was prefilled with the name from the user's Google Account.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCardCardholderNameWasEdited
histogram.summary: If the cardholder name fix flow is shown during credit card upload and the user accepts upload, logs whether the final cardholder name was changed from its prefilled value or not.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCardRequestExpirationDateReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason expiration date was explicitly requested from the user during credit card save.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPrompt
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2021 as it is replaced by Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer and Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptResult.
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept or deny the Autofill save credit card prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which the Autofill save credit card prompt is shown or not. Logged when the flow is triggered and the prompt should be shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptResult
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept or deny the Autofill save credit card prompt. Logged when users interacted with the prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.ScanCreditCard.Completed
histogram.summary: Whether a credit card scan was completed or cancelled.

histogram.name: Autofill.ScanCreditCard.Duration
histogram.summary: How long a credit card took to scan.

histogram.name: Autofill.ScanCreditCardPrompt
histogram.summary: Usage of the "Scan card" control item.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerCardLinkClicked
histogram.summary: Logged when the user clicks on the server credit card link in the settings page.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerQueryResponse
histogram.summary: The usefulness of Autofill server information.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerResponseHasDataForForm
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill server had at least some prediction data for a given form at query response time.

histogram.name: Autofill.Snackbar.{SnackbarType}.ActionClicked
histogram.summary: Emits true when the action button on the autofill snackbar is clicked and does not emit any value otherwise.

histogram.name: Autofill.Snackbar.{SnackbarType}.Shown
histogram.summary: Emits true when the autofill snackbar is displayed and does not emit any value otherwise.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredCreditCardCount
histogram.summary: The number of credit cards a user has stored, measured at Chrome profile launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredCreditCardCount.Server.WithCardArtImage
histogram.summary: The number of server cards with a valid card art image, measured at Chrome profile launch.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredCreditCardCount.Server.WithVirtualCardMetadata
histogram.summary: The number of server cards with virtual card metadata, measured at Chrome profile launch.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredCreditCardDisusedCount
histogram.summary: The number of disused credit cards a user has stored, measured at Chrome profile launch time. This is only reported for users who have at least one stored credit card.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileCount
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill addresses a user has stored, measured at launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileCountAtAutofillableFormSubmission
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill addresses a user has stored, measured when an autofillable form is submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileDisusedCount
histogram.summary: The number of stored Autofill address profiles which have not been used in a sufficiently long time for autofill to consider them disused. Measured once per Chrome user profile launch.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.CreditCardSaveNotOfferedDueToMaxStrikes
histogram.summary: Records when credit card save is not offered (either at all on mobile or by simply not showing the bubble on desktop) due to the candidate card having too many strikes.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.LocalCardMigrationNotOfferedDueToMaxStrikes
histogram.summary: Records when local card migration is not offered due to the candidate's LocalCardMigration strike count reaching maximum strikes.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.NthStrikeAdded
histogram.summary: Records the number of "strikes" a particular feature has when a new strike is added for that feature.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.StrikeDatabaseInitFailed
histogram.summary: When a StrikeDatabase fails to initialize, records the number of consecutive failed initialization attempts.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.StrikesPresentWhenLocalCardMigrationAccepted
histogram.summary: Records the number of "strikes" a user has when local card migration is accepted.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.StrikesPresentWhenLocalCardSaved
histogram.summary: Records the number of "strikes" a given card had when a user opted to save the card to Chrome.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.StrikesPresentWhenServerCardSaved
histogram.summary: Records the number of "strikes" a given card had when a user successfully uploaded the card to Google Payments.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.StrikesPresentWhenStrikeExpired
histogram.summary: Records the number of "strikes" present in a StrikeDatabase entry when a strike expires.

histogram.name: Autofill.SubmittedCardState
histogram.summary: Metric to measure credit card state when form is submitted, specifically if it had a valid card number and/or expiration date.

histogram.name: Autofill.SubmittedServerCardExpirationStatus
histogram.summary: Metric to measure if a submitted card's expiration date matches the same server card's expiration date (unmasked or not). Cards are considered to be the same if they have the same card number (if unmasked) or if they have the same network and last four digits (if masked).

histogram.name: Autofill.SubmittedValuePatterns
histogram.summary: Metric to measure if a submitted form contains any recognizable value patterns (e.g., Unified Payment Interface Virtual Payment address (UPI VPA)). Reported for every submitted non-empty visible field observed by Autofill.

histogram.name: Autofill.SuggestionAccepted.OffTheRecord
histogram.summary: Records acceptance of autofill suggestions in regular and off-the-record modes.

histogram.name: Autofill.SuggestionAcceptedIndex
histogram.summary: The index of the accepted Autofill suggestion in the popup. Due to crbug.com/966411, the iOS data is incorrect.

histogram.name: Autofill.SuggestionAcceptedIndex.Autocomplete
histogram.summary: The index of the accepted Autocomplete suggestion in the popup. Due to crbug.com/966411, the iOS data is incorrect.

histogram.name: Autofill.SuggestionShown.OffTheRecord
histogram.summary: Records showing of autofill suggestions in regular and off-the-record modes.

histogram.name: Autofill.Timing.DetermineHeuristicTypes
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between the start and end of FormStructure::DetermineHeuristicTypes().

histogram.name: Autofill.Timing.ParseForm
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between the start and end of parsing a single form.

histogram.name: Autofill.TranslatedPageLanguage
histogram.summary: The visible page language (best guess of the original or the translated language, if translation was used) upon form submission. This is a sparse histogram where the integer value represents the language code as described by the ISO 639 standard.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.Duration
histogram.summary: Duration of the interaction with the UnmaskPrompt since it was shown until it was closed. This prompt is triggered when a user selects a masked card in an autofill dropdown.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.Events
histogram.summary: Events tracking the usage of the unmasking prompt. This prompt is triggered when a user selects a masked card in a autofill dropdown.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.GetRealPanDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of the GetRealPan API call. This API call is triggered by the unmasking prompt when the user types information to verify their ownership of the card being fetched.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.GetRealPanDuration.{CardType}.{Result}
histogram.summary: Duration of the GetRealPan API call. This API call is triggered by the unmasking prompt when the user types information to verify their ownership of the card being fetched. Broken down by the type of the card being fetched and the result.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.GetRealPanResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of the GetRealPan API call. This API call is triggered by the unmasking prompt when the user types information to verify their ownership of the card being fetched.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.GetRealPanResult.{CardType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of the GetRealPan API call. This API call is triggered by the unmasking prompt when the user types information to verify their ownership of the card being fetched. Broken down by type of the card being fetched.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.TimeBeforeAbandonUnmasking
histogram.summary: Time the user waited before abandoning an unmasking operation. In such a scenario, the user is cancelling a pending unmasking operation (possibly because it is taking too long). The time measured here corresponds to the time between the user clicking the "Verify" button and then clicking "Cancel".

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.UnmaskingDuration
histogram.summary: Duration between the user clicking the Verify button within the unmasking prompt until we get a response back from the server. This prompt is triggered when a user selects a masked card in an autofill dropdown.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.UnmaskingDuration.{CardType}.{Result}
histogram.summary: Duration between the user clicking the Verify button within the unmasking prompt until we get a response back from the server. This prompt is triggered when a user selects a masked card in an autofill dropdown. Broken down by the type of the card being fetched and the result.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnownedFieldsWereFiltered
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2021 as it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: Records incidents where an implicit (formless) form has elements filtered out of it. This happens to unowned fields (directly embedded in the page with no enclosing <form> tag) without autocomplete attributes if formless forms are restricted to "checkout" pages. Logged when parsing forms/fields.

histogram.name: Autofill.Upload.BackoffDelay
histogram.summary: The delay of a network request for an upload due to exponential backoff.

histogram.name: Autofill.Upload.FailingPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that were sent in an upload that subsequently failed. This is to help determine if there are certain upload sizes which are prone to failure.

histogram.name: Autofill.Upload.HttpResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: The http response code or net error code returned on an upload.

histogram.name: Autofill.Upload.MetadataConfigIsValid
histogram.summary: Tracks whether or not the configuration fo metadata upload encoding is valid or invalid. Note that if the configuration is invalid, the client will fall back to a default configuration that sends 4 bits per byte (i.e., either the even or odd bits encoding).

histogram.name: Autofill.Upload.MetadataEncodingType
histogram.summary: The metadata encoding scheme used by the client to encode rich uploads.

histogram.name: Autofill.Upload.RequestDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of a network request for an upload.

histogram.name: Autofill.UploadAcceptedCardOrigin
histogram.summary: Measures if a card for which upload was accepted is already stored as a local card on the device or if it has not yet been seen.

histogram.name: Autofill.UploadEvent
histogram.summary: Whether or not an upload was sent after having been triggered by a form submission or proxy-form-submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.UploadOfferedCardOrigin
histogram.summary: Measures if a card for which upload was offered is already stored as a local on the device or if it has not yet been seen.

histogram.name: Autofill.UsedCachedServerCard
histogram.summary: Records the number of times that the cache for unmasked server cards has been accessed for a given card. For example, if the cache is being accessed and it has already been accessed for the card twice before, then "3" is recorded.

histogram.name: Autofill.UsedCachedVirtualCard
histogram.summary: Records the number of times that the cache for virtual cards has been accessed for a given card. For example, if the cache is being accessed and it has already been accessed for the card twice before, then "3" is recorded.

histogram.name: Autofill.UserHappiness
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of various events in the Autofill user interaction flow. By comparing frequencies, we can compute several interesting "user happiness" metrics.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCard.MetadataSynced
histogram.summary: The number of times that virtual card metadata is propagated via Chrome Sync. It is logged based on whether the metadata is for an existing card or a new card.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardManualFallbackBubble.FieldClicked
histogram.summary: Records which field in the virtual card manual fallback bubble was selected by the user and had its contents copied to the clipboard. Recorded on every click of a field in the bubble.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardManualFallbackBubble.Result.{ShowType}
histogram.summary: Records the reason for closing the virtual card manual fallback bubble. Recorded when the bubble is closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardManualFallbackBubble.Shown
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded whenever the virtual card manual fallback bubble is shown, after the user has just unmasked and autofilled a virtual card. It records whether the bubble has just appeared for the first time (false) or if it is being reshown due to user actions (true).

histogram.name: Autofill.WalletAddressConversionType
histogram.summary: Tracks how the different wallet addresses are converted to local autofill profiles.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebOTP.OneTimeCode.FillDuration.FromInteraction
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for form with autocomplete="one-time-code". An interaction requires changing a form control's value manually or via autofill. The interaction can happen on a different form than the one which is submitted. This is recorded once per form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebOTP.OneTimeCode.FillDuration.FromLoad
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for forms with autocomplete="one-time-code". This is recorded once per form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebOTP.OneTimeCode.FromAutocomplete
histogram.summary: Records whether a frame has ever used autocomplete="one-time-code" during its lifecycle. i.e. it's only recorded once per frame. In addition, we only record it if the frame has parsed forms.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebOTP.PhoneNumberCollection.ParseResult
histogram.summary:
Records whether a frame collects phone number based on the field classification. It records once per frame only if it has parsed forms.
Note that the field types may not be calculated if there are less than 3 fields in the form unless an autocomplete attribute is provided. e.g. if the form has only a single field regarding phone number without specifiying autocomplete="phone", a sample with "false" will be reported.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebOTP.PhonePlusWebOTPPlusOTC
histogram.summary: Records whether a document collected phone number, and/or used WebOTP, and/or used OneTimeCode (OTC) during its lifecycle. i.e. it's recorded in the browser process when a document is destroyed.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.AutofillSession
histogram.summary: Records the state of an autofill session.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.AwGIsCurrentService
histogram.summary: Records whether Autofill with Google is the current Android autofill service. It is recorded on AutofillProvider initialization. Only recorded in Android P and beyond.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.CreatedByActivityContext
histogram.summary: Whether the autofill is created by activity context.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.Enabled
histogram.summary: Whether the autofill service is enabled in Android platform.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.ServerPrediction.AwGSuggestionAvailability
histogram.summary: Records whether Autofill with Google has suggestions and if the user selects any suggestion. It is recorded when the form is submitted. Only recorded in Android P and beyond.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.ServerPredicton.HasValidServerPrediction
histogram.summary: Records whether the server prediction of any field isn't NO_SERVER_DATA. This histogram is recorded when the server prediction is available for the current form, and only if AndroidAutofillQueryServerFieldTypes feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.ServerPredicton.PredictionAvailability
histogram.summary: Records whether and when the server prediction response of current autofill session is available even if query failed or there is no server data. This histogram is recorded when the prediction becomes available or the new session starts, and only if AndroidAutofillQueryServerFieldTypes feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.SubmissionSource
histogram.summary: Records the source of form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.SuggestionTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to display suggestion.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.UserChangedAutofilledField
histogram.summary: Whether the user changed autofilled field.
